title: World number 94 Kim wins US Women's Open on debut
description: World number 94 A-Lim Kim claims her first major title with a stunning final round at the US Women's Open.

title: Hunger spikes, demand rises for US food banks
description: Amid the pandemic, one in eight Americans say their household has experienced a food shortage.

title: Covid-19: Greenwich Council ordered to keep schools open
description: The education secretary threatens legal action after classes were moved online amid Covid case rise.

title: Stargazers watch the total eclipse in Argentina's Neuquen province
description: Tourists and scientists gathered at an observation site in Argentina to witness the total eclipse.

title: Another home defeat for Arsenal? Lawro's Premier League predictions v Travis bassist Dougie Payne
description: Mark Lawrenson takes on Travis bassist Dougie Payne for the midweek Premier League fixtures.

title: No fans at London events after move to tier three
description: Sporting events in London will not have fans attending from Wednesday after the capital is moved into the highest tier of coronavirus restrictions.

title: 'For three rounds he gave me a beating' - the last time Fury and Joshua shared the ring
description: Demand for Anthony Joshua to fight Tyson Fury is intensifying but the pair have actually shared the ring before.

title: 'The phone rang, it was Gerard. He was asking my partner’s view on a substitution'
description: BBC Sport chief football writer Phil McNulty remembers the career of Gerard Houllier, who has died at the age of 73.

title: Google outage: YouTube, Docs and Gmail knocked offline
description: Users around the world were unable to access applications including YouTube, Gmail and Docs.

title: Covid: Swansea Bay suspends some non-urgent care amid rising cases
description: Swansea Bay is the second in Wales to cancel some outpatient appointments and non-urgent surgery.

title: Covid: London likely to move to tier 3 amid rising rates
description: Health officials are said to be “deeply concerned” about the number of Covid cases in the capital.

title: People in Scotland told to 'cut down contacts' before Christmas
description: Nicola Sturgeon says Scots planning to meet up at Christmas should cut down on "unnecessary contacts" now.

title: Leeds man who 'begged' for MRI scan dies from cancer
description: Sherwin Hall made 13 hospital visits before he was given an MRI scan which revealed several tumours.

title: Man Utd face La Liga leaders Sociedad & Arsenal get Benfica - full Europa League draw
description: Manchester United will face David Silva's La Liga leaders Real Sociedad in the last 32 of the Europa League.

title: Ireland and Scotland in same 2023 World Cup pool as South Africa
description: Ireland and Scotland will face each other in the pool stages of the 2023 Rugby World Cup in France.

title: New York cathedral gunman shot dead by police
description: Witnesses say the man yelled "Kill me" as he opened fire near the Cathedral of St John the Divine.

title: How fact met fiction in Le Carré's secret world
description: The novelist's career was shaped by his experience of espionage - and influenced the work of spies.

title: Gerard Houllier: Former Liverpool manager dies aged 73
description: Former Liverpool manager Gerard Houllier has died at the age of 73.

title: Chelsea play Atletico while Liverpool & Man City face German clubs in Champions League
description: Liverpool face RB Leipzig, Chelsea take on Atletico Madrid and Manchester City play Borussia Monchengladbach in the last 16 of the Champions League.

title: Australia storms: Dog rescued and beaches damaged as extreme weather hits coast
description: Hazel disappeared under a sea of foam at Byron Bay as wild weather battered the coast.

title: Brexit: Negotiators to enter 'extra mile' talks
description: It comes after the two sides agreed on Sunday there had been enough progress for talks to continue.

title: Cyberpunk 2077 makers apologise for game glitches
description: Players are reporting performance issues and the game crashing on PS4 and Xbox One.

title: John le Carré: Tributes paid to 'a writer of immense quality'
description: Writers including Robert Harris and Ian Rankin remember an author "who transcended his genre".

title: Coronavirus and Christmas: Going home not 'worth the risk'
description: Families are having tough conversations about whether to risk seeing each other at Christmas.

title: All Windrush victims to get at least £10,000
description: People wrongly threatened because of immigration policy changes previously received a minimum of £250.

title: Geminid meteor shower dazzles night skies
description: Some of the best views of the annual meteor shower were above Lijiang city in southwest China.

title: Sports Personality of the Year: Stuart Broad on taking 500th Test wicket
description: Sports Personality of the Year contender Stuart Broad reflects on the achievement of taking his 500th Test wicket for England during the summer series win over the West Indies.

title: US election 2020: What is the electoral college?
description: The president of the United States is not chosen directly by voters, but by what's known as the electoral college.

title: The Papers: Extra time in Brexit talks for a 'final push'
description: The ongoing Brexit talks dominate the front pages as the UK and EU agree to extend negotiations.

title: The new podcast ‘smashing the box’ of disabled feminism
description: An 'unsanitised' retelling of the lives of Helen Keller, Mabel Normand and Rosa May Billinghurst in a new podcast reveals their impact on modern feminism.

title: Contact tracer: 'People threaten us and block our calls'
description: An NHS Test and Trace worker says many members of the public don't answer or refuse to co-operate.

title: The surprise Christmas show for an audience of one
description: Dundee Rep Theatre is staging individual performances of its Christmas show at the homes of lucky nominees.

title: Challenging dementia 'stigma' in Asian communities
description: Nirmal Singh says he wants his community to learn from his family's experience with the disease.

title: Kenya's black market baby trade: A mother's choice
description: What drives a mother to sell her baby? The story of a woman caught between poverty and traffickers.

title: Spain housing: Evictions and broken promises in a pandemic
description: Spain's prime minister promised nobody would be evicted during the pandemic but activists say thousands have.

title: How clean is the air in your office?
description: Due to Covid, and many of us hoping to return to the office in 2021, workplace air quality is a growing concern.

title: How do we know new vaccines are safe?
description: The NHS is carrying out the biggest mass vaccination campaign in its history - what safety checks were made?

title: Brexit: 'It's utter confusion' over trade talks delay
description: Business across Britain tell BBC News of their frustration at post-Brexit trade talks being extended.
